item.title: [ROO-2533] Problems with Cloud Foundry Addon in 1.1.4
item.description:
There are several problems with the Cloud Foundry Addon in Spring Roo 1.1.4

Install with
– addon install bundle --bundleSymbolicName org.springframework.roo.addon.cloud.foundry
fails and results in:
NullPointerException at org.springframework.roo.addon.roobot.client.AddOnR ooBotOperationsImpl.installOrUpgradeAddOn(AddOnRoo BotOperation)

After advice I used this command:
addon install bundle --bundleSymbolicName org.springframework.roo.addon.cloud.foundry;1.1.4.RELEASE

This works for installing the addon but fails then on deploy command:

roo> cloud foundry deploy --appName wedding1234 --path CREATE
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Building wedding
[INFO] task-segment: [clean, package]
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
...
[INFO] Webapp assembled in [1130 msecs]
[INFO] Building war: D:\jens\transport\workspace-roo\wedding\target\wedding-0.1.
0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.war
[WARNING] Warning: selected war files include a WEB-INF/web.xml which will be ig
nored
(webxml attribute is missing from war task, or ignoreWebxml attribute is specifi
ed as 'true')
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESSFUL
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 12 seconds
[INFO] Finished at: Mon Jun 27 15:42:28 CEST 2011
[INFO] Final Memory: 58M/509M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
NullPointerException at org.springframework.roo.addon.cloud.foundry.CloudF oundry
Commands.push(CloudFoundryCommands.java:114)

Alternatively I tried:
roo> cloud foundry deploy --appName wedding1234 --path target/wedding-0.1.0.BUIL
D-SNAPSHOT.war
NullPointerException at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:222)

(The file target/wedding-0.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.war exists and it also happens with other samples from 1.1.4)

Please see also the discussion thread here:
http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?111154-cannot-install-cloud-foundry-addon&s=bd01dbd11f8149f7f4fd054152d15fb3

Creating a JIRA as suggested.
item.summary: Problems with Cloud Foundry Addon in 1.1.4

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Hey Jens, the problem was that Windows paths weren't being interpreted. This has been fixed in commit 75020b525cf65cae77b19734624eff26ef879549

Thanks James, this is excellent. I can confirm that it works if I download the latest snapshot. Great news!

However there is a still a (minor) bug: If I use a backslash in the --path option this results in a NullPointerException:

~.web.PublicRsvpController roo> cloud foundry deploy --appName wedding122 --path
target\wedding-0.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.war
NullPointerException at java.io.File.<init>(File.java:222)

If I use a slash it is fine:
~.web.PublicRsvpController roo> cloud foundry deploy --appName wedding123 --path
target/wedding-0.1.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT.war
~.web.PublicRsvpController roo>

Perhaps you can fix this too before the release (I think the backslash works in other roo commands)

Hey Jens, in commit cf2ca9dc85002420e386ffb007e94de18e2b9427 it is now possible to use either "/" or "\" file separators when specifying an application to deploy. I have also added checks to see if the file exists and a few null checks when retrieving application stats.
